briefdescription.para: The location where we wish to store data. As it's not possible to save/load from File in WebGL, if the default location is File it will use PlayerPrefs instead.
Gets the full, absolute path which this ES3Settings object identifies.
The path associated with this ES3Settings object, if any.
The type of encryption to use when encrypting data, if any.
The type of encryption to use when encrypting data, if any.
The password to use when encrypting data.
The default directory in which to store files, and the location which relative paths should be relative to.
What format to use when serialising and deserialising data.
Whether we want to pretty print JSON.
Any stream buffers will be set to this length in bytes.
The text encoding to use for text-based format. Note that changing this may invalidate previous save data.
Whether we should check that the data we are loading from a file matches the method we are using to load it.
Enabling this ensures that only serialisable fields are serialised. Otherwise, possibly unsafe fields and properties will be serialised.
Whether UnityEngine.Object members should be stored by value, reference or both.
Whether the main save methods should save UnityEngine.Objects by value, reference, or both.
How many levels of hierarchy Easy Save will serialise. This is used to protect against cyclic references.
The names of the Assemblies we should try to load our ES3Types from.
Creates a new ES3Settings object with the given path.

parameterdescription.para: The path associated with this ES3Settings object.
The settings we want to use to override the default settings.

briefdescription.para: Creates a new ES3Settings object with the given path.

parameterdescription.para: The path associated with this ES3Settings object.
Accepts an ES3.EncryptionType, ES3.CompressionType, ES3.Location, ES3.Directory or ES3.ReferenceMode.

briefdescription.para: Creates a new ES3Settings object with the given path.

parameterdescription.para: The path associated with this ES3Settings object.
Accepts an ES3.EncryptionType, ES3.CompressionType, ES3.Location, ES3.Directory or ES3.ReferenceMode.

briefdescription.para: Creates a new ES3Settings object with the given encryption settings.

parameterdescription.para: The type of encryption to use, if any.
The password to use when encrypting data.

memberdef.argsstring: (string path, ES3.EncryptionType encryptionType, string encryptionPassword, ES3Settings settings=null)
memberdef.name: ES3Settings

briefdescription.para: Creates a new ES3Settings object with the given path and encryption settings.

parameterdescription.para: The path associated with this ES3Settings object.
The type of encryption to use, if any.
The password to use when encrypting data.
The settings we want to use to override the default settings.
